availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Lindsay (Hickman County, Kentucky, attorney and assistant quartermaster)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, attorney and assistant quartermaster. Virginia native. Son of Andrew Lindsey and Sally Gilmore Davidson. Studied law under John W. Brockenborough in Lexington, Virginia, until 1854. Studied law under Edward Crossland in Clinton, Hickman County, Kentucky. Admitted to the bar in 1858. Attorney in Hickman County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (C.S.A.) as assistant quartermaster from July 2, 1861 until May 6, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Rockbridge County, District 51, p. 412A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 511.
H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 90-1.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 332-3.
Find A Grave, "William Lindsay (1835-1909)," Memorial #7644184, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7644184 (accessed August 18, 2020).
